For example, the IT services expenditure as a percentage of GDP in 2019 was at 1.4% in France and 1.5% in Spain, with these countries still being relatively early in the shift to cloud-based services and solutions. We believe this indicates a forward growth trajectory for these markets as both private and public sector customers continue to increase their IT investments to remain competitive and fill the technology gap that currently exists in comparison with other main EU countries. The French and Spanish IT services markets are expected to resume their growth trajectories at a CAGR of 5.5% and 6.9%, respectively, for the 2021 – 2025 period. See “Industry.” Through our strategic position in these and other key markets, we aim to benefit from the expected structural digital transformation and rise in demand for IT services. We also aim to maintain and consolidate our leadership position in our core activities (such as Application Services and Business Solutions), as well as in our various industry verticals (such as Public Sector and Healthcare and Financial Services), while continuing our service portfolio transformation towards our Business Solutions and Consulting activities. We believe that expanding and cross-selling services will help us continue to be an IT services and solutions provider of choice and a strategic partner for our key customers.

Subsection Title: Top 35
Subsubsection Title: Accelerate the shift of our revenue mix towards digital services and solutions to accelerate business growth and profitability
Subsubsection Text: In line with market trends, we have been investing in strengthening our digital capabilities with approximately 40% of our total contract value deriving from digital services and solutions in 2020, with a goal to increase that percentage to approximately 60% in the coming years. Our customers increasingly allocate a significant portion of their budgets to cloud-based applications, digital infrastructure, cybersecurity, automation and data analytics, which are key drivers of our digital-led growth. As a result, meeting our customers’ increasing needs in the digital space has become a key focus for us and an area where we intend to generate revenue growth. We have the resources and expertise, including a deep knowledge of legacy IT infrastructures, to accompany our customers in their digital transformation journey. We believe this is particularly valued by customers in our key industry verticals (Financial Services and Public Sector and Healthcare) where a smooth transition is crucial given the mission critical nature of their processes and the high cost of failure due to their highly regulated nature. We also see focused investments in talent and vendor partnerships as an opportunity to accelerate the shift of our revenue mix towards digital services and solutions, with corresponding uplift in organic revenue growth and margin, and believe this is an approach followed successfully by other competitors. We intend to build on our leadership position in our core IT activities to be a leading digital services provider, and we believe our existing customer base and our global delivery model based on proximity to the customer provide a robust base to achieve this. Digital projects we have undertaken for customers include the cloud migration of the technical base of BNP Paribas’s electronic payment system, the redesign and migration of the customer-facing website of BNP Insurance, the migration of corporate customer front-end applications to DevOps and cloud for Orange, the redesign of data warehousing to Google Cloud hosting for Orange, the automation of the process of closing current accounts and passbook accounts for Orange, the cloud migration of databases and management of data APIs for Société Générale and the automation of back-office processes as part of retail bank convergence project within Société Générale. Furthermore, we are a long-standing partner of market leading software and cloud vendors for workplace solutions (including Red Hat, Oracle and ServiceNow), data center and multi-cloud providers (including ----- AWS, Google Cloud and Microsoft Azure) and network and security providers (including Palo Alto Networks). For instance, we benefit from a relationship with SAP spanning over 20 years, resulting in approximately 2,300 accreditations and 350 certifications. We seek to keep and reinforce our long-standing partnerships with these global software and cloud players as our customers’ needs increasingly shift to digital solutions.

Subsection Title: Top 35
Subsubsection Title: Continue to pursue growth initiatives and opportunities in the large and growing upper mid-market segment
Subsubsection Text: We intend to continue leveraging our market expansion track record to push significant growth initiatives throughout our business. One of our key initiatives continues to be increasing the proportion of revenue generated by our Business Solutions and Consulting activities as we view these as areas with higher added value and greater revenue growth potential in light of digitalization trends. To pursue additional growth opportunities, we intend to further scale our platform in new geographies and focus on the development of our industry vertical-focused offerings. As one of the largest multi-local players in fragmented IT services markets where scale increasingly matters, we believe that the trend among our customers to consolidate to key partners will benefit large IT service providers (such as ourselves), who can absorb a large portion of IT expenditure from recurring customers. We also seek to capture growth in the upper mid-market segment, leveraging its shift to digital and cloud. This represents a particularly attractive opportunity for us, given our strong presence in the mid-market segment and the fact that there is less competition for such mid-market customers than for larger companies. To adapt our services and solutions to such companies, we intend to continue delivering a comprehensive offering tailored to address these customers’ needs through our broad technical capabilities and local footprint, which we believe gives us a structural advantage against potential competitors by being one of the “one-stop shops” within our industry.

Subsection Title: Top 35
Subsubsection Title: Further enhance profitability through identified levers
Subsubsection Text: We seek to continue leveraging our diversified operating platform and realizing economies of scale to grow our profitability and improve our margins. We see significant potential to improve our profitability when comparing ourselves to some of our peers (our Adjusted EBITDA margin was 10.5% in 2021, which was below the (non-weighted) average of our peers in the French mid-cap market (12.7%), regional providers (14.5%), digital competitors (17.7%) and global IT players (19.8%) (adjusted from public figures to exclude (i) expenses linked to share-based payments and (ii) other operating income and expenses)), we believe that we have the potential to close this gap through several identified, tangible levers. We intend to streamline our organization by simplifying our processes, nearshoring our back-office and increasing capacity utilization. We also intend to optimize our subcontracting process by improving our relationships and increasing synergies with our subcontractors and internalizing longer-tenure subcontractors. We also seek to increase the flexibility of our cost structure by improving our processes in connection with selling, general and administrative expenses by providing local and tailored services and solutions to targeted and underpenetrated markets. Furthermore, we plan on focusing on the lean industrialization and automation of our processes, leading to more efficient delivery, reduced costs and timely execution of our projects. In addition, we seek to realize more effective synergies from future acquisitions, and to realize the full potential of businesses we have already acquired, particularly IECISA, a Spanish technology consulting company with strong market positions in Spain, Portugal and LatAm.

Subsection Title: Top 35
Subsubsection Title: Continue making targeted and opportunistic acquisitions to expand our portfolio, capabilities and geographic presence
Subsubsection Text: The IT services market remains highly fragmented and we intend to further strengthen our position and broaden our product portfolio, capabilities and geographic presence by continuing to consolidate smaller players. We have been one of the most active consolidation platforms in the IT services markets in which we operate, successfully acquiring and integrating more than 25 companies since 2016. We have developed a disciplined and systematic approach to acquisition activity, targeting best-in-class specialized IT players with a focus on increasing our capabilities in high-growth areas and consolidating our positions across our industry verticals. We pursue acquisitions that we believe are supported by a strong business case of value creation, provide business continuity and limit disruption to profitability. We believe that this continued focus on acquiring and integrating specialized providers of IT services will allow us to further cross-sell acquired services and solutions into our broad customer base, attract and retain talented employees and strengthen our R&D capabilities. ----- Our future acquisition strategy will focus on attractive and accretive add-ons to complement our envisaged organic growth and increase our scale and synergies, in addition to high margin capabilities to our portfolio, reinforcing our existing footprint and expanding into new territories and further developing our offering and access to strategic assets and partnerships.

Subsection Title: Top 35
Subsubsection Title: History
Subsubsection Text: We were founded in 1970 as Gfi Informatique. Over the course of over five decades, we have grown both organically and through acquisitions to become one of the leading pan-European providers of IT services and solutions. In 1998, we completed an initial public offering on the French stock exchange. From our founding through the early 2000s, we focused on growing organically, as well as making strategic acquisitions, to build our expertise in IT services and solutions and we also substantially expanded our operations in Southern Europe during this period. In 2008, Apax Partners France and Altamir became shareholders of the Group and, in 2009, Vincent Rouaix became our Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, leading us through a period of transformation, during which we recentered our business to focus on the industrialization of our offering, take an industry vertical-based approach and enhance the value-added nature of our services and solutions. Between 2009 and 2011, we implemented a strategic plan to strengthen our business model by focusing on higher value-added activities and updating our delivery models to include onshore, nearshore and offshore offerings. Between 2011 and 2015, following a period of organic growth, we focused on our mergers and acquisitions strategy, which helped accelerate our transformation and concentrate our positions with our major customers in France, as well as internationally. In 2016, Mannai Corporation became our majority shareholder and we delisted our shares from the French stock exchange. In 2016 and 2017, we further expanded our operations in Spain with the acquisition of Efron, a consulting business (2016), in LatAm with the acquisition of Gesfor México, an outsourcing and consulting business (2017), in Portugal with the acquisition of ROFF, an SAP business (2016), in Poland with the acquisition of Impaq, a company providing IT services for blue-chip companies (2016) and in Africa with the acquisition of Value Pass, a Moroccan SAP business (2017), as well as in France with the acquisitions of Metaware, a leading provider of services and solutions for systems modernization, and Novulys, a CRM specialist (2016). Between 2018 and 2020, we reinforced our operations in high-potential geographic areas, with the acquisitions of Realdolmen, a Belgian information and communications technology company (2018) and in new international markets, Bridgeo, a company focused on Sage solutions implementation based in Cameroon and operating in Central Africa (2019) and Capital Consulting and Archos Technology in Morocco (2019). In 2019, we completed six tactical acquisitions, including the acquisitions of SIS, a French company specialized in emergency information systems and alert processing, Hundred, a Peruvian software-publishing group, and I2S, a software publisher specialized in the insurance market in Iberia and Africa, and we reaffirmed our commitment to innovation with the opening of two new FabLabs in Lyon and Madrid. In 2020, we entered a new era in our international development with the acquisition and integration of Informática El Corte Inglés Group (“IECISA”), a Spanish technology consulting company with strong market positions in Spain, Portugal and LatAm, making us a major European technology leader and strengthening our positioning in Iberia and LatAm. In 2021, after ten years of continuous growth, we harmonized our identity at the international level and became Inetum and centered our mission around providing “positive digital flow.” In the same year, we acquired Ilex International, a French identity and access management software developer, Projixi Europe, a French automation, cloud and DevOps company, and HLi Consulting, a CRM dynamics integrator with operations in Morocco and Tunisia. In July 2022, the Sponsors became our majority shareholders following the acquisition by the Issuer of approximately 99% of the share capital of Inetum from Mannai Corporation. See “The Transactions—The Acquisition.”

Subsection Title: Top 35
Subsubsection Title: Business Model
Subsubsection Text: We are a leading IT services and solutions business serving over 10,000 customers across eight key industry verticals: Public Sector and Healthcare, Financial Services, Transport Travel Services (TTS), Energy, Utilities and Chemicals (EUC), Retail and Consumer Goods (RCG), Telecom Media Technology (TMT), Industry and Services and Defense and Security. Our business addresses markets across five geographic areas: France, Iberia, BeLux, LatAm and Other (which encompasses all other countries in which we operate in Europe, the Middle East, Asia and Africa). ----- Our business model is differentiated by our proximity to our customers, who we serve through our 21 global service centers, and the agility with which we address and anticipate our customers’ digital transformation needs. To add value for our customers, we focus significant resources on innovation, with seven FabLabs in Europe and North Africa (and an eighth expected to be opened in Warsaw in 2022), which are environments dedicated to the exploration of new technologies and the analysis of new challenges, as well as on industrialization and automation, which improve our reactiveness, productivity and the quality of our diversified end-to-end services and solutions. We provide a wide range of end-to-end services, from customized integration and solutions development and consulting, to outsourcing and value-added reselling, combining innovation-based differentiation and automation-based efficiency. Our digital offering addresses new digital uses and their impacts on our customers’ value chains, in order to help them establish their digital roadmap. This approach is reflected in a number of our offerings that combine proven development methods (such as DevOps and Agile, design thinking and IP and solutions) with the adoption of new technologies (such as Big Data, AI, AI Ops, social robotics, smart agent, computer vision and blockchain).We estimate that digital services and solutions offerings accounted for approximately 40% of our total contract value for the year ended December 31, 2020.

Subsection Title: Top 35
Subsubsection Title: Activities
Subsubsection Text: We categorize our portfolio of services into six activities: Application Services, Business Solutions, Infrastructure Services, Value-Added Reselling, Outsourcing and Consulting, which are complemented by our cross-functional Software Solutions. Each of our activities is described below. Application Services In our Application Services activity, we offer our customers the capabilities and tools to make their organizations “digital,” as well as offering a range of multi-modal IT management services, from advanced application management to testing and IT modernization based on agility and appization, from migration and cloud services to cloud-ready development and DevOps. We develop data-centric strategies for our customers, such as by supporting the deployment of data strategies, data optimization and value-added services and the implementation of new business intelligence and Big Data solutions. Two recent examples of the strength of our Application Services activity are the maintenance and application work we provided to Santander in Spain and Portugal and the OSMOZE digital projects we created for SNCF in France (on which we spent approximately 7,500 person-days on build projects), which focused on e-dispatches and e-contract modernization and information services in DevOps and Agile. We generated €418.4 million of revenue in the twelve months ended June 30, 2022 from our Application Services activity, which represented 35.5% of our total revenue for the same period. We estimate that direct margin (which we define as (x) the revenue generated by an activity less the direct costs associated with that activity divided by (y) revenue generated by that activity, expressed as a percentage) from our Application Services activity amounted to approximately 26% for the year ended December 31, 2021. Business Solutions In our Business Solutions activity, we offer customers a customized digital experience with solutions to personalize and configure their offerings, drive omnichannel customer journeys, nurture prospects with digital technology, optimize self-management and increase end-customer loyalty (including customer contact automation, CRM, CMS, portals and customer data platforms), as well as digital employee experience solutions to attract and retain talent by promoting a true digital culture (through, for example, HCM and payroll solutions) and solutions designed to improve their financial and operational performance, including solutions that promote reliable financial information, manage risks and optimize operations with the latest and most innovative SCM, EPM, ECM, ERP, billing and business performance management solutions. As an example of the strength of our Business Solutions activity, we recently implemented ServiceNow, a cloudcomputing platform. Additionally, we are a leading SAP supplier to intelligent enterprise customers, with over 20 years of experience and 11 global SAP service centers. As an example of the strength of our SAP-based Business Solutions offering, in Portugal, we recently provided EDP with integration, deployment, support, maintenance and cloud strategy for SAP for accounting, controlling, purchasing, supply chain, inventory, sales and HR functions (on which we spent approximately 25,000 person-days per year of the relevant projects). ----- We generated €253.2 million of revenue in the twelve months ended June 30, 2022 from our Business Solutions activity, which represented 21.5% of our total revenue for the same period. We estimate that direct margin from our Business Solutions activity amounted to approximately 29% for the year ended December 31, 2021. Infrastructure Services In our Infrastructure Services activity, we help customers reinvent their IT operations to be suited to a multimodal and hybrid environment that is economically optimized, agile and scalable to the pace and footprint that their businesses need. Our Infrastructure Services offering includes cloud management, cybersecurity, application modernization and next-generation advanced IT operations tailored to the customer’s infrastructure, generally without deploying any of our own data centers or infrastructure. We apply smart data, development and automation technologies to our IT operations and provide data exploitation services to customers, such as building and operating Big Data infrastructure and analyzing usage behavior to improve performance and efficiency. As a recent example, in France, we provided Leroy Merlin and Adeo with application production outsourcing on cloud and private servers across twelve countries, 28 business units, approximately 3,500 servers and approximately 800 databases and, in Spain, we helped Mapfre with their digital workplace transformation, virtualization and cloud migration. We generated €194.5 million of revenue in the twelve months ended June 30, 2022 from our Infrastructure Services activity, which represented 16.5% of our total revenue for the same period. We estimate that direct margin from our Infrastructure Services activity amounted to approximately 26% for the year ended December 31, 2021. Value-Added Reselling (VAR) In our Value-Added Reselling (“VAR”) activity, we help customers purchase and procure the hardware and software they need to implement their digital transformation plans and keep the right technology in place on ongoing basis. This offering is tailored to the needs of our customers’ businesses, in terms of mobility, availability, performance, security, management and scalability. In order to further improve transparency and budget predictability for our customers, we now offer pay-peruse models as part of our VAR offering (which we refer to as “VAR as a service”). In addition, our new approach to this offer provides customers with the option of having a single contract that addresses devices, management, financing and buy-back, which facilitates product life cycle management. As an example of how we serve customers in our VAR activity, we modernized BBVA’s digital infrastructure using Google Cloud, deploying a collaboration suite of tools, web portals and features to help boost employee productivity. We generated €96.8 million of revenue in the twelve months ended June 30, 2022 from our VAR activity, which represented 8.2% of our total revenue for the same period. Outsourcing In our Outsourcing activity, we integrate business solutions outsourcing (“BSO”) (including end-to-end design, building, development and operations for application maintenance and infrastructure), global outsourcing (“GO”) (including projects in which we take over part or all of a customer’s IT department, including the purchase of assets by us and transfer of HR functions to us) and infrastructure outsourcing (“ISO”) (including managed and hosted IaaS based on our cloud platform and/or through hybrid cloud solutions with Azure, Amazon Web Services and Google Cloud in a well-balanced hybrid cloud solution, with onshore and nearshore IT support) to implement IS transformation, agility, DevOps, architecture optimization and IT process solutions. As an example of the customer relationships in our Outsourcing activity, we have been the exclusive IT outsourcer of Euskaltel in Spain since 2014, with 160 of our FTEs working on end-to-end IT outsourcing projects, including IT transformation, application management and infrastructure management. We generated €92.5 million of revenue in the twelve months ended June 30, 2022 from our Outsourcing activity, which represented 7.9% of our total revenue for the same period. We estimate that direct margin from our Outsourcing activity amounted to approximately 26% for the year ended December 31, 2021. Consulting In our Consulting activity, we offer business and digital consulting services that (i) assist our customers in the implementation of a successful digital strategy, for instance by defining roadmaps for the implementation of digital solutions and risk management plans, (ii) guide customers through business transformations by ----- leveraging our expertise across multiple industry verticals and (iii) drive the digital impact of our customers’ traditional IT environments, with plans for end-to-end automation, AI and smart data dashboards and IoT project planning. Our business and digital consulting teams address the concerns our customers are currently facing by combining functional and technological expertise that allows business and IT functions to work hand in hand to serve end customers. Two examples in which we have provided Consulting services that enable this sort of collaboration are the shopfloor digitalization studies we prepared for Airbus (on which we spent approximately 600 person-days) and a real estate management improvement process that we carried out for the French Ministry of Finance. We generated €30.1 million of revenue in the twelve months ended June 30, 2022 from our Consulting activity, which represented 2.6% of our total revenue for the same period. We estimate that direct margin from our Consulting activity amounted to approximately 35% for the year ended December 31, 2021. Software Solutions As a software publisher, we offer our own catalogue of business software to more than 4,000 customers in our Public Sector and Healthcare, Financial Services and RCG industry verticals, as well as offering cybersecurity and transversal solutions, as described further below. - Public Sector and Healthcare Software Solutions: includes our solutions that make us a partner to customers in the Public Sector and Healthcare industry vertical through digital, regulatory and territorial transformation. We believe we are one of the leading software vendors for the public sector in Europe, with more than 40 years of experience assisting approximately 3,000 public organizations, according to our estimates. We generated 44% of our Software Solutions revenue in the year ended December 31, 2021 from Public Sector and Healthcare customers. - Financial Services and Insurance Software Solutions: includes our compliance solutions for providers of property and casualty insurance, personal insurance and life insurance to more than eight million individuals in coordination with 14 brokers, insurers and bank insurers, according to our estimates. In the twelve months ended June 30, 2022, we monitored approximately 14 million property and casualty insurance contracts and managed approximately €14 billion in assets, according to our estimates. We generated 21% of our Software Solutions revenue in the year ended December 31, 2021 from Financial Services customers. - RCG and Supply Chain Software Solutions: includes our offering of stock planning, warehouse management or ERP solutions to more than 150 retailers, manufacturers, distributors, wholesalers and logistics service providers, according to our estimates. - Cybersecurity solutions: with the acquisition of Ilex International, a leading developer of IAM software in France, we strengthened our cybersecurity offer and now provide IAM solutions across our geographic areas to more than 14 million end-users in the Financial Services, Defense and Security, Healthcare, TMT, EUC and RCG industry verticals, according to our estimates. Our scalable platform gives customers a global view of their IAM needs and provides a comprehensive response to their challenges. - Transversal solutions: includes our solutions dedicated to time and activity management for approximately 800 customers, with approximately 5.5 million plans managed in the twelve months ended June 30, 2022, according to our estimates. We also managed approximately 200 million documents for approximately 250 customers in 5 countries through our content management solution services in the twelve months ended June 30, 2022, according to our estimates. Our offering also includes document flow processing and digital communication, distribution and electronic security. We generated 33% of our Software Solutions revenue in the year ended December 31, 2021 from transversal solutions. As a recent example of the success of our Software Solutions activity, we managed the improvement and modernization of the Musée d’Orsay’s accounting, HR and time management activities and implemented Cleva to replace Groupama’s group healthcare insurance software. We generated €92.2 million of revenue in the twelve months ended June 30, 2022 from our Software Solutions activity, which represented 7.8% of our total revenue for the same period, and revenue from our Software Solutions activity grew at a CAGR of 7.9% between 2019 and 2021. We estimate that direct margin from our Software Solutions activity amounted to approximately 57% for the year ended December 31, 2021.

Subsection Title: Top 35
Subsubsection Title: Industry Verticals
Subsubsection Text: We offer our services and solutions to customers in eight industry verticals: Public Sector and Healthcare, Financial Services, TTS, EUC, RCG, TMT, Industry and Services and Defense and Security. The graphic below presents a breakdown of our revenue by industry vertical for the twelve months ended June 30, 2022. ----- ## Revenue by industry vertical Industry & Services 7% TMT 9% RCG 10% EUC 10% Defence & Security 5% TTS 11% Public Sector & Healthcare 25% Financial Services 22% _Source: Company information._ We believe that our flexible structure and well-diversified services and solutions offering enables us to crosssell to our customers in different industry verticals. For instance, we adapt and modify certain aspects of our Application Services and Software Solutions for customers across various industry verticals, including by leveraging our digital-enabling technologies in the Public Sector and Healthcare industry vertical. Public Sector and Healthcare Our offering to customers in the Public Sector and Healthcare industry vertical includes services and solutions aimed at accelerating the modernization of public and health services (including through the implementation of ERP-based management models) in order to, among other things, improve the relationship between public authorities and citizens, support the ecological transition and enable flexible working environments and mobility of civil servants (noting that public sector customers discussed here exclude defense and security authorities, which are discussed in “—Defense and Security” below). We provide a wide range of services and solutions to help public authorities meet the challenges of the new citizen and digital territories, including services and solutions aimed at (i) consulting services to guide public institutions in the adoption of digital and open government models, digital education, re-engineering and automation of public procurement processes and property management, (ii) improving the citizen experience with a public/social CRM approach, citizen and transparency portals, and open data platforms, (iii) assisting digital government initiatives, such as by using telematics notifications, procedure and case management platforms (such as through e-registries), unified information and documentation repositories (such as through e-archives) and automating public entities’ processes through ERP and (iv) shaping smart territories with our intelligent city solutions. In addition to these services, we offer powerful proprietary IP software solutions for Public Sector customers, which differentiates our offering in areas such as finance, HR, school transport, intelligent and collaborative territories, social protection, taxation and management of urban planning and housing, emergency medical services, fire services and emergency management. We provide our Healthcare customers with the necessary tools to implement a patient-centered approach, ensuring continuity of care and personalization of the relationship with the end-customer (i.e., the patient). To help our Healthcare customers achieve this goal, the solutions we offer include: - Solutions for public/private healthcare organizations, such as electronic health record management and investment banking, hospital management platform, emergency call dispatch, data analysis, digital imaging solutions, clinical research management, trial management and monitoring, sample management, medical and non-medical time management solutions; - Solutions for medical-social organizations and local authorities, such as social assistance, social services, disability services and parent and child protection solutions; and ----- - Solutions for health territories, such as care coordination pathways, intelligent health, regional platforms, connected objects, telemedicine and home automation solutions. We also provide our Healthcare customers, such as hospitals, with a variety of solutions, such as clinical trial (Eficienza-CRM), emergency SAP (Centaure15), time management (Chronotime workplace), clinical research (Easydore), sample management (eDataBiotec), health chatbots (BotFoundry), parent and child protection (Horus), wellness (Iodas), smart health solutions (Kartéis), social robotics (Pepper) and hospital management platform solutions (HospitalAX). In 2021, we served more than 1,250 customers in the Public Sector and Healthcare industry vertical, including the European Journal of Industrial Engineering, the French central agency for social security (Acoss), the French finance ministry’s money laundering unit (Tracfin), the French and Portuguese ministries of justice, the Paris hospital authority and the EU Intellectual Property Office, and generated €319.7 million of revenue in the twelve months ended June 30, 2022, or 27.1% of our total revenue for the same period, from customers in the Public Sector and Healthcare industry vertical. Financial Services Our offering to customers in the Financial Services industry vertical leverages our strong regulatory and market knowledge, as well as our integrated offering of AI-based solutions, software solutions, advanced analytics, cybersecurity, cloud services, digital twin technology, blockchain products and digital workplace solutions. This offering includes IT services relating to funds administration, payments and settlement solutions, regulatory compliance, risk management and credit management. Through this offering, we assist our customers in transforming data, managing processes, transitioning into open ecosystems and optimizing internal processes to reduce operational friction. Supported by a dedicated team, including corporate and investment banking and insurance experts, we offer services based on digitalization and innovation to our Financial Services customers. The services and solutions we offer customers in the Financial Services industry vertical complement their businesses by: (i) enabling the acceleration of their digital transition, from digital onboarding, to the implementation of their customer portals, the digitization of end-to-end banking processes and the development of biometric solutions, (ii) enhancing their business performance with customer relationship management and digital marketing development tools, (iii) enhancing banking customers’ mobile and web applications, (iv) expanding digital payments use, including through instant payments and cash management evolution and integration, (v) driving projects with smart data and AI for risk management, compliance and back-office efficiency, (vi) bolstering cybersecurity and IT risk management, (vii) providing specific solutions for insurance, such as Cleva (an insurance software solution), Bdoc (a digital document tool) and Traviata (an insurance-specific CRM tool) and (viii) helping companies meet new sustainability standards, such as through sustainable finance consulting. In 2021, we served more than 50 customers in the Financial Services industry vertical and benefit from longstanding relationships with large banking, insurance, capital markets and other financial institutions, including six of the largest French and Spanish financial institutions (BNP Paribas, Crédit Agricole, Société Générale, Santander, Bankia and BBVA). We generated €266.6 million of revenue in the twelve months ended June 30, 2022, or 22.6% of our total revenue for the same period, from customers in the Financial Services industry vertical. Transport Travel Services (TTS) Our offering to customers in the TTS industry vertical includes the provision of end-to-end integration of travel management solutions, intelligent transport services, green mobility solutions, transport infrastructure security, smart water and energy management solutions, logistics solutions, software and digital passenger solutions, as well as the improvement of logistics based on SCM solutions. We target specific players who differentiate themselves through service-oriented models, including both B2C—people services customers (focused on customer experience and service quality) and B2B—business services customers (focused on effective workforce management and talent acquisition). The activities we conduct for our customers in the TTS industry vertical include (i) improving the passenger experience through CRM, user experience interfaces and portals, passenger information and kiosks and contactless/self-secured check-in, (ii) making transport intelligent, with smart ticketing, green mobility, mobility as a service (MaaS), intelligent traffic and intelligent transport systems, tolling, solutions for airports and railways (including land management), IoT and blockchain solutions for transport and tracking and ----- control solutions, (iii) ensuring the safety of transport infrastructure with biometric security at check-in and boarding and mobile road safety applications, (iv) launching new services through digital platforms, such as social and e-health platforms, and (v) increasing business efficiency and profitability with intelligent automation solutions and improving financial and operational performance with billing solutions. In 2021, we served approximately 180 customers in the TTS industry vertical, including La Poste, Iberia, the Geneva public transport authority, Accor Hotels, Ferrovial, SNCF, Maersk, Amadeus and Metro, and generated €131.9 million of revenue in the twelve months ended June 30, 2022, or 11.2% of our total revenue for the same period, from customers in the TTS industry vertical. Energy, Utilities and Chemicals (EUC) We offer our energy and utility customers services and solutions that help them address their regulatory and energy transition needs, which range from providing connected equipment between our customers and their end-customers, to providing industrial IoT solutions, energy management systems, e-mobility, legacy systems and customer information systems. For our customers in the chemicals industry, we provide services and solutions that build our customers’ resilience in the event of disruption and ensure digital continuity throughout our customers’ value chains, from R&D to end-customers. The activities we conduct in relation to our energy and utilities customers include (i) aiding the production and generation of electricity through product lifecycle management and digital matching, energy asset management and predictive maintenance, (ii) providing transmission and distribution solutions, including field services, smart grids and e-mobility solutions, (iii) providing retail and commercial services across the customer’s digital journey and providing CRM solutions, meter-to-cash, and energy services and (iv) helping customers make the energy transition and develop renewable energies through the design and implementation of new services and business models for energy suppliers and consumers. The activities we engage in for our chemicals customers include improving the customer and patient experience by working as an integrator of e-commerce solutions in the marketplace with the Inetum Eficienza vertical solution and implementing a medical and regulatory management solution across clinical trials, ensuring security, cybersecurity and document management. In 2021, we served more than 40 customers in the EUC industry vertical, including the largest energy and utilities providers in France, such as EDF, the leading French electricity generation and distribution provider, as well as TotalEnergies and Veolia, and generated €112.0 million of revenue in the twelve months ended June 30, 2022, or 9.5% of our total revenue for the same period, from customers in the EUC industry vertical. Retail and Consumer Goods (RCG) Our offering to customers in the RCG industry vertical includes wide range of services and solutions, which focus on the integration of physical and digital channels for a new retail experience, the design and implementation of an IT roadmap for a best-of-breed model and optimization of digital flow with suppliers from product catalogue through the supply chain. These services and solutions include (i) supporting the customer journey and experience through an omnichannel strategy and e-commerce/merchandise platforms (such as SAP Hybris and Magento), (ii) enhancing customer management and marketing solutions with a single customer repository, CRM, campaign management and loyalty programs (such as Adobe Marketing), (iii) implementing SAP for retail and fashion for end-to-end financial and supply chain management and managing logistics platforms (such as OptiDock), (iv) ensuring simplicity and efficiency of IT functions by relying on specialized ERP solutions (such as Inetum Minos) and (v) applying innovation for product traceability and regulatory management, using blockchain as a service and IoT, and predictive maintenance to reduce production line downtime. In 2021, we served approximately 500 customers in the RCG industry vertical, including several French multinational retailers (Les Mousquetaires, Auchan, Carrefour) and large corporations (IKEA, Mars, IKKS and Fnac Darty) and generated €92.5 million of revenue in the twelve months ended June 30, 2022, or 7.9% of our total revenue for the same period, from customers in the RCG industry vertical. Telecom, Media and Technology (TMT) With more than 20 years of experience serving the TMT industry vertical, and as an active member of TM Forum (a global industry association for service providers and their suppliers in the telecommunications industry), we leverage our international partnerships with software developers and our know-how in the ----- different sectors of the industry to enable customers to make the necessary updates to their marketing model and their billing support systems (“BSS”) and network operations systems (“OSS”), which supports their multiservice offers. We provide our TMT customers with a wide range of services and solutions, which focus on helping them reduce IT costs, develop their technology functions, improve time-to-market and reduce churn. This drives improved end-customer experience and predictive behavioral analysis, creates more agile and less expensive virtualized networks and improves customer service productivity through end-to-end process integration. The activities we conduct in relation to our TMT industry vertical include a wide range of vertical and transversal solutions focusing on (i) integrating open-source solutions (such as BSS/OSS) and migrating to an open digital architecture to reduce time-to-market and IT costs, (ii) virtualizing network functions to become agile and deliver 5G network services and facilitate IoT deployment and operations, (iii) ensuring telecoms interoperability and number portability and (iv) improving the customer experience (such as through CRM, portal, billing and call center solutions) and data management strategy (such as through AI, Big Data, smart data analytics, business integration and data virtualization). In 2021, we served approximately 70 customers in the TMT industry vertical, including major telecommunications and media providers such as Orange, Telefónica, Vodafone, Másmóvil, Nokia and Huawei, and generated €111.3 million of revenue in the twelve months ended June 30, 2022, or 9.5% of our total revenue for the same period, from customers in the TMT industry vertical. Industry and Services We provide a wide range of IT and outsourcing services and solutions to customers who operate in various sectors of the Industry and Services industry vertical, including the automotive, aerospace, manufacturing, fashion, agriculture and transportation sectors. We are leading our strategy towards greener, more efficient and smarter production by helping customers define their business roadmaps, implement projects, improve their IT architecture, manage robotic process automation implementation and integrate hardware and software solutions. The activities we conduct for customers in our Industry and Services industry vertical include automotive data management, improvement of the customer experience through data valorization and signal intelligence and infrastructure monitoring. We particularly focus on (i) supporting the customer experience with e-commerce solutions, portals, mobility, billing and procurement and user experience-based interfaces, (ii) using “Industry 4.0” solutions, which are based on the tracking of products and services from design to maintenance and automatic customization, to make industrial processes more efficient and flexible and (iii) implementing function optimization to support business performance, such as with S/4 HANA, robotic process automation, modern workplace and HCM solutions. In 2021, we served approximately 100 customers in the Industry and Services industry vertical, including leading automobile manufacturers, such as Renault, Rolls Royce and Toyota. We also serve large French corporations involved in the manufacturing of devices and equipment for automobile and aerospace, including Airbus, Michelin and Thales. We generated €95.9 million of revenue in the twelve months ended June 30, 2022, or 8.1% of our total revenue for the same period, from customers in the Industry and Services industry vertical. Defense and Security We recently augmented our business model to address the Defense and Security industry vertical in order to better serve and assist in the development and digital evolution of customers in this industry vertical, whether they are public entities or private companies. For example, responding to the needs of police and military forces, we design, develop and build complete and advanced signal intelligence, command and control solutions. Similarly, we are able to provide services and solutions for access and surveillance of critical infrastructure (such as border protection and homeland security systems). Our offering to customers in the Defense and Security industry vertical include (i) using data and AI to automate routine tasks and make better decisions at all levels, helping our customers to grow their operations and businesses with confidence in an increasingly complex environment, (ii) moving to cloud-based solutions to increase the efficiency and agility of public institutions and private enterprises, based on the highest security standards and providing the interoperability capabilities needed to manage larger ecosystems and (iii) providing digital transformation services to fully align IT with business strategy, preparing organizations to make the most of innovative technologies. An example of the services we provide to customers in our ----- Defense and Security activity is the work we do for the Interior Ministry of Spain, with whom we have a long and well-established relationship: we believe we are one of this ministry’s important suppliers. Another example is the work we do for Naval Group in relation to our Infrastructure Services activity. Naval Group is a French industrial contractor, designer and overall integrator of warships and combat systems. Most of the work we do for customers in the Defense and Security industry vertical is done under fixed-price contracts relating to our Application Services activity or relates to our VAR activity. In 2021, we served more than 20 customers in France, Belgium and Spain in the Defense and Security industry vertical, including the various sovereign entities, such as the French ministry of defense and ministry of justice, as well as the defense industry more generally. We generated €48.6 million of revenue in the twelve months ended June 30, 2022, or 4.1% of our total revenue for the same period, from customers in the Defense and Security industry vertical.

Subsection Title: Top 35
Subsubsection Title: Geographic Areas
Subsubsection Text: We have a large and growing footprint with subsidiaries in 29 countries, grouped into five geographic areas: France, Iberia (which includes Spain and Portugal), BeLux (which includes Belgium and Luxembourg), LatAm (which includes Argentina, Brazil, Costa Rica, Chile, Colombia, the Dominican Republic, Mexico, Panama, Peru and the United States) and Other (which includes the other countries in Europe, the Middle East, Asia and Africa in which we operate, encompassing Angola, Bulgaria, Cameroon, Egypt, Ivory Coast, Morocco, Poland, Romania, Senegal, Singapore, Switzerland, Tunisia, the United Arab Emirates and the United Kingdom). We also service projects and customers in countries where we may not have a physical presence. As of June 30, 2022, we had more than 27,000 FTEs, including 4,100 subcontractors and 946 freelancers, working across over 100 sites, including over 80 sales offices. The graphic below presents a breakdown of our revenue by geographic area for the year ended December 31, 2021. LatAm 4% Other 4% France 41% BeLux 14% Iberia 37% # By geographic area _Source: Company information._ France Our French business is supported by our long-term historical presence and strength in France and is characterized by our ability to offer a wide range of services and solutions to a strong portfolio of historical customers. Our top customer accounts in France include international CAC 40 companies, many of which have used us as a key IT partner for several years. Mid-cap companies are also a growing customer segment for us, particularly in France. Our French mid-cap customers include Aubay and Neurones. We have more than 9,500 employees spread over 54 facilities across France, including 17 sales offices. We also have three French FabLabs, in Paris, Lyon and Nantes, and more than 1,300 employees in our shared service centers in Lyon, Lille and Nantes. ----- Iberia _Spain_ Following the IECISA acquisition, Spain became our second largest market. We have more than 6,000 employees working in 23 sales offices spread across Spain, including in and around Alicante, Barcelona, Madrid and Bilbao, and we have one FabLab in Madrid. Spain is the leader in our SAP practice targeting small and medium-sized enterprises. In 2021, we built on our existing vertical solutions offering in Spain, such as solutions for customers in the Healthcare, TTS and Defense and Security industry verticals. Our Spanish customer portfolio remains strong, including 32 of the 35 IBEX companies, of which three (Telefonica, El Corte Inglés and Banco Santander) are among our top ten customers. _Portugal_ In Portugal, our activity has grown rapidly in recent years and we are now a strategic IT and digital partner to many large and medium-sized companies, supporting their IT and digital transformation strategy. With offices in Lisbon, Porto, Bragança and Covilhã, we have more than 2,500 employees working in IT services, SAP and outsystems, transformation projects, value-added reselling and software. We have one FabLab in Lisbon, which develops new technologies in areas such as virtual and augmented reality, SAP, chatbots and computer vision, among other things. We also operate five service centers in Portugal. BeLux _Belgium_ In Belgium, we have more than 1,500 employees who support a large number of customers, including multinational companies, medium-sized companies and federal and regional government institutions, for which we have been a key technology partner for many years, helping them address all aspects of their digital transformation. We have one FabLab in Ghent and have offices in Huizingen, Kontich, Ghent, Leuven, Lummen and Mons. _Luxembourg_ In Luxembourg, where we have operated for more than 30 years and have approximately 80 employees, we are continuing our expansion strategy with respect to our cloud computing and managed services offering, as well as expanding our focus on the Industry and Services and Public Sector industry verticals. LatAm In LatAm, we provide IT solutions to customers in the Financial Services, Public Sector and Healthcare, TMT, Industry and Services and RCG industry verticals. In our LatAm business, we support our Spanish and Portuguese customers’ projects in the region, with over 2,000 employees working in 14 sales offices located in Mexico, Colombia, Peru, Brazil and other Latin American countries, as well as the United States. Other _Other Countries in Europe_ Our employees in other European countries (approximately 600) are spread across Poland (reinforced by our acquisition of JCommerce in April 2022), Romania, Switzerland and the United Kingdom. In June 2022, we acquired Do IT Wise, a leading digital transformation company based on ServiceNow, established in Bulgaria and operating a service center for international customers. In the other countries in Europe in which we operate, we offer vertical software solutions dedicated to customers operating in the TMT, Defense and Security, Financial Services, RCG and TTS industry verticals, as well as horizontal solutions, such as time and activity management, digital document management, compliance and fraud detection to a strong portfolio of loyal customers in the Financial Services, TMT, TTS and Defense and Security industry verticals, among others. _The Middle East and Asia_ In the Middle East and Asia, our strategy is based on local presence and expertise working with the public sector (such as through our smart cities and smart government solutions) and with the telecommunications industry, supported by strong local partnerships with Oracle, Outsystems, BotPress, iValua, SoftBank and Huawei, among others, and leveraging our capabilities and strategic alliances. Our ----- employees in the Middle East and Asia are spread across our sales offices located in Dubai (United Arab Emirates), where we serve the Gulf Cooperation Council countries (Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, United Arab Emirates, Qatar, Bahrain and Oman), as well as Egypt and Jordan. _Africa_ Our presence in Africa has significantly increased since our entry into this market in 2003 through various acquisitions we made over the last 19 years, including Somafor in Côte d’Ivoire, Cynapsys in Tunisia, Bridgeo in Cameroon and Professional Systems, Value Pass and Capital Consulting in Morocco. With more than 900 employees working in sales offices based in various African countries, we cover a large part of operational consulting, application development, maintenance and outsourcing services on the continent, thanks to our global service offer for the implementation and evolution of the software package for multi-site/multi-country projects. We have a strong customer portfolio in Africa, with more than 500 private companies and public operators and work with many large international or pan-African groups.

Subsection Title: Top 35
Subsubsection Title: Customers
Subsubsection Text: We have a well-diversified customer base of over 10,000 customers, including large private and blue-chip companies and public sector bodies. We also serve and target small- and medium-sized enterprises, as well as some micro-businesses. In the year ended December 31, 2021, our business benefited from significantly lower customer concentration, with our top 35 customers accounting for 35.3% of our revenue (as compared to 55.6% in 2016) and no customer accounting for more than 2.8% of our revenue. Our top ten customers accounted for 17.5% of our revenue in the year ended December 31, 2021. Furthermore, most of the value captured from our top customers is generated across several contracts relating to a variety of our services and solutions, which often have different termination dates, which further protects us from depending on specific customers and contracts. We have created long-term, strategic relationships with our customers and we believe we are often an integral and mission-critical part of their businesses. We benefit from long-lasting customer relationships, with an average contract length of greater than three years for the multi-year contracts in France. More than half of our top ten customers have been with us for more than ten years and almost all of our ten largest accounts from 2012 are still within our top 16 customers today, which demonstrates the strong degree of customer loyalty we enjoy, which is built on our track-record of cost-effective service delivery, customized business solutions, local regulatory and market knowledge, as well as our significant know-how in complex IT architectures. We are consistently recognized as one of the best partners for pricing, relationship and flexibility and our customer satisfaction rate was approximately 90% in France in the year ended December 31, 2021 (according to customer satisfaction surveys that we perform at the end of projects on a continuous basis), which we believe contributes to our increasing contract renewal rates (calculated on the basis of the total value of existing contracts rolled forward in any given year), which in France have been above 90% since 2019 and at 95% in the year ended December 31, 2021, and the longevity of our customer relationships. Customer Contracts We have put in place standard contracts adapted to our various services and solutions offers. Time-based contracts:_ we enter into time and material (“T&M”) variable-cost contracts for short-term (3 to 6 months) projects of a repeatable nature, such as requests for technical assistance or ad hoc consulting. We estimate that we derived approximately 29% of our revenue from T&M contracts for the year ended December 31, 2021. System Integration, Application Management and Other:_ we enter into fixed-price contracts for projects with a defined mandate (such as application management or systems integration) averaging approximately four years. We estimate that we derived approximately 21% of our revenue for the year ended December 31, 2021 from such contracts. Project Build:_ we enter into fixed-price contracts for one-off projects that may not, due to the nature of the project, result in ongoing maintenance work or generate long-term opportunities. We estimate that we derived approximately 16% of our revenue for the year ended December 31, 2021 from Project Build contracts. Outsourcing:_ we enter into fixed-price contracts in connection with our Outsourcing activity averaging approximately four years in length. We estimate that we derived approximately 14% of our revenue for the year ended December 31, 2021 from Outsourcing contracts. ----- Software Solutions contracts:_ we enter into sales contracts for sales of our internally developed Software Solutions, which usually involve a one-time licensing fee or recurring charges under a SaaS delivery model. We estimate that we derived approximately 8% of our revenue for the year ended December 31, 2021 from such contracts. VAR:_ we also enter into contracts for resale of software and hardware entered into in connection with our VAR activity, where we charge a one-time agency fee for the transaction. We estimate that we derived approximately 12% of our revenue for the year ended December 31, 2021 from VAR contracts. Contracts valued above a certain threshold (€200,000) are reviewed by our legal department in order to validate and secure our contractual commitments. Additionally, our risk management committee meets regularly to ensure the identification and management of our most sensitive contracts. In terms of contract size, we have a well- diversified portfolio, which is predominantly composed of relatively small contracts.

Subsection Title: Top 35
Subsubsection Text: ~35% **+7% ~56% 2016 2021 _Source: Company information_ Our loyal and sticky customer base provides us with high level of revenue predictability and visibility, both through contractually recurring business and highly repeatable business. A large portion of our customer contracts are long-term in nature, leading to recurring revenue. For example, the length of our project-based contracts across our customer base in France is on average greater than three years. In addition, a significant portion of our revenue, such as certain “time and material” contracts and revenue from our Value-Added Reselling activity, which while not contractually recurring, in our experience are repeatable in nature. We estimate that recurring and highly repeatable revenue accounted for approximately 70% of our total revenue for the year ended December 31, 2020. As of January 2022, we estimate that approximately 71% of our 2022 yearly budget was covered through amounts expected to be realized in connection with projects in our weighted pipeline, time and material (“T&M”) contracts for the next three months and oral commitments. This amount increased from approximately 67% in 2021, which we believe reflects our strong demand backlog and gives us a good level of revenue visibility, barring significant changes in the macroeconomic backdrop which could impact our weighted pipeline in particular. We also believe our high customer satisfaction, the long-term nature of our customer relationships and the breadth and quality of our services and solutions present important cross-selling opportunities, particularly as we pursue our strategy of growing revenue from digital services and solutions, along with our Business Services and Consulting activities which we view as activities with higher added value and greater revenue growth potential.

Subsection Title: Suppliers and Partners
Subsubsection Text: We have strong relationships with many major IT and software companies with a focus on workplace solutions (such as ServiceNow, Oracle, Amazon Web Services, Red Hat, Microsoft and Google Cloud), multi-cloud solutions (such as PTC, Magento, Liferay, Sage, Oracle, Opencell, Genesys, Microsoft Dynamics, SAP and Salesforce) and networking and security solutions (such as Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud and Microsoft). The chart below presents further details regarding the term of, related accreditations and certifications and partnership level with certain of these suppliers and partners, as of 2021. _Source: Company information._ We rely on many of these companies both for the supply of certain services and products necessary for the operation of our business, such as hardware and certain software products and services (in which case we refer to them as suppliers), and for the provision of services and solutions that we manage, implement and co-develop to our customers (in which case we refer to them as partners). The IT services and solutions that we manage, implement and co-develop with our partners include, among others, cybersecurity, cloud, AI and robotic process automation solutions. ----- We use products and services provided by our suppliers in the provision of our own services and solutions as follows: - Integration. Products and services provided by our suppliers are often complementary to our own services and solutions, and we are able to integrate our own offerings with those of our suppliers. - Incorporation. We purchase or procure products and services from our suppliers that are necessary for the operation of our services and solutions. - Resale. We enter into distribution agreements that allow us to sell products and services of our suppliers to our customers. We benefit from long-lasting, multi-year relationships with our suppliers and partners and, given our nature of open partner ecosystem, we constantly continue to expand our partnership network.

Subsection Title: Research and Development (R&D) and Innovation
Subsubsection Text: Innovation has always been a key element for our competitiveness, long-term sustainability and success. The strategy underlying our investment in R&D is based on our ambition to continuously increase our value to our customers and partners, as well as to inspire ideas for change and instill the dynamic of “it’s possible” within our company. We continuously invest in R&D and innovation to support the ongoing improvement of our organization, thereby increasing our competitive capacity and fulfilling the needs of a fluid, rapidly changing market. We invested approximately €50.0 million, €58.0 million and €59.0 million on R&D in the years ended December 31, 2019, 2020 and 2021, respectively. We are currently involved in research projects within the following key areas, spanning our industry verticals: digital industry, smart transportation, digital and physical security, smart city, smart government, energy, waste management, 5G, digital media, cloud, Big Data, blockchain and AI. In general, we seek to focus on areas that are not yet targeted by our competitors, including: - creation of new services and solutions that do not exist in the market, with a high return on investment, and that meet the needs of a world with a constantly changing digital flow; - generation of intellectual property that can be exploited by our activities, which may be software or services, depending on customer needs; - identification of new uses or new services or solutions, as early as possible, to take advantage of unmet customer needs; - creation or modification of the means of production to improve margins; - management and organization of the dissemination of knowledge within our company; and - organization of open innovation in collaboration with customers, prospects and strategic partners, while relying on ecosystems of start-ups and our academic partners. Our innovation program is part of a structured process under the responsibility of our innovation department, which is headed by our chief innovation officer. Our senior management defines the major technological directions in which we invest, as well as the solutions that are expected to bring them to market. These major orientations are materialized in the form of key themes within which each R&D and/or innovation project is embedded. In 2021, we focused our efforts on the following themes: AI to serve our customers’ businesses, AI for operations (AI Ops), AI for development (AI Dev), virtual and augmented reality, the value and intelligence of Big Data, IoT, cybersecurity, blockchain and new tools for modelling and developing new services and solutions. _FabLabs_ Driven by our intention of maximizing the chances for commercialization of our R&D work, we created a unique ecosystem called the FabLab. The main objective of a FabLab is to create an environment dedicated to the exploration of new technologies and the analysis of new challenges, by setting up new venues for concentrating on multidisciplinary projects, welcoming industrial and academic partners and encouraging creativity. The FabLabs aim to host projects from their theoretical formulation to their pre-industrialization phase. During co-creation sessions held with our customers, partners and internal teams, we invent tomorrow’s solutions to address our customers’ business challenges. A FabLab includes: - Research activities, which include scientific publications and research operations with partners; ----- - Solution development activities, which are based on our research to bring original horizontal solutions (e.g., a multi-use technology platform) or vertical solutions (e.g., a service that meets a specific business need) to the market; and - Design thinking, acculturation and prototyping activities, to better understand the needs of our customers and bring them into contact with the innovations we proposed. We have seven FabLabs located in Paris, Nantes, Lyon, Gent, Lisbon, Madrid, Casablanca (and an eighth expected to be opened in Warsaw in 2022). Our network of FabLabs provides us with a unique tool to ensure that our know-how and our ability to offer new services and solutions as close as possible to our customers’ needs is deployed at the local level and is coordinated by our innovation department. _R&D and Innovation Partnerships_ Our innovation strategy is based on various partnerships aimed at investigating key scientific fields for which we do not have the required expertise, as well as developing new uses and new approaches through coinnovation with our partners. These partnerships are also intended to speed up the arrival of innovations on the market. In 2021, we had around ten key R&D and innovation partnerships, including: - Academic Partners: We continued our research activities in partnership with universities such as MINES ParisTech, University of Technology of Troyes, University of Angers, University of Technology of Compiègne and initiated research activities on three new topics with other universities. - Health Sector Research Program: We continued our research program in partnership with the Heart and Vessel Unit of the Cardiac Surgery Department at Bichat Hospital with the aim of improving patient follow-up and the daily life of health care staff by developing an innovative technological solution for the remote monitoring of postoperative patients who have undergone coronary bypass surgery. We also carry out actions in partnership with The FondaMentale Foundation, to strengthen care pathways in the field of mental disorders, and La Prévention Routière aimed at helping reduce road violence. _Services and Solutions Resulting from Our R&D and Innovation Work_ Several of our research projects have resulted in technologies that we use in our IT services, software and digital platforms, thereby transforming and improving our offering to our customers. For example, BotFoundry (a chatbot factory), Metachatbot, Firmin Business (integration of the Pepper robot into organizations’ reception processes), Vision Learn (real-time image detection and analysis application) and AI OPS are some of our most notable achievements. We believe that our strong focus on R&D and innovation, as well as the significant amount of resources deployed to train our technology engineers, core process specialists and digital scientist, coupled with our strategic acquisitions, will help us face the risks surrounding talent shortages in the IT industry in the IT industry, which is a key challenge in the IT sector.

Subsection Title: Sales and Marketing
Subsubsection Text: We leverage our broad, multi-industry service and solution offerings to develop packaged solutions tailored to achieve a specific scope of work that we then offer to customers, while maintaining a disciplined approach to pricing and contracting. Our sales and marketing teams coordinate to ensure the effective targeting of prospective customers. We market our services and solutions to both existing and potential customers directly, using a local approach. We also focus on developing prospective customer relationships through market research and analysis, renewing expiring contracts and leveraging existing customer relationships to offer additional services and solutions. Our sales efforts typically involve extended selling cycles and our expertise in specific industries is critical to secure new business opportunities. Strategic accounts are managed by global account managers, with the remaining local accounts being managed by the local business unit. Within our geographic areas, our sales force is primarily organized by industry vertical-specific teams that are supported by activity-specific personnel. Our sales force receives a fixed salary and an additional variable portion based on performance. Significant new business opportunities are reviewed by business and sales leaders from the applicable industry vertical, operations personnel and members of our finance department. If they determine that the new business is aligned with our strategic objectives and a good use of our resources, then our business development team is authorized to pursue the opportunity. -----

Subsection Title: Intellectual Property
Subsubsection Text: We provide value to our customers based in part on a differentiated range of proprietary inventions, methodologies, software, reusable knowledge capital and other intellectual property. We recognize the increasing value of intellectual property in the marketplace and create, harvest, and protect this intellectual property. We leverage trade secret, copyright, trademark and patent laws, as well as contractual arrangements to protect our intellectual property. We own a number of patents, trademarks and copyrights worldwide and often have pending patent, trademark and copyright applications. We seek patent protection for those inventions likely to be incorporated into our services and solutions, or where obtaining such proprietary rights is possible and will improve our competitive position. We do not hold any patents that are material to our businesses. As of June 30, 2022, we held more than 500 trademark registrations in France and the European Union. Our business relies on software. With respect to proprietary software, we claim copyright on all such software, registering works, which may be accessible to third parties. In addition, we rely on maintaining source code confidentiality to ensure our market competitiveness. We also use third party intellectual property. We have acquired all material licenses for such software and any other third party intellectual property. We comply with the terms and conditions of these licenses and have not faced any material claims in relation to the breach of any third party copyrights.

Subsection Title: Regulation
Subsubsection Text: In providing services and solutions to customers, we often manage, utilize and store sensitive or confidential customer or company data, including personal data, and therefore we must comply with strict data protection and privacy laws, such as the GDPR, in all the jurisdictions in which we operate. For more information, see “Risk Factors—Risks Relating to Laws and Regulations—We and our customers are subject to extensive _governmental regulation, and changes in these regulations, or the failure by us or any of our third-party suppliers to comply with these regulations, could harm our business.”_

Subsection Title: Properties
Subsubsection Text: Our headquarters are located in Saint-Ouen in France. We operate over 80 sales offices and 21 global service centers in Europe, LatAm, the Middle East, Asia and Africa. We lease the majority of our facilities and we own two properties located in France in Albi and Nîmes, respectively. Our strategy for property is focused on building and maintaining our European proximity network of service centers, specialized service centers and agencies.

Subsection Title: Quality Assurance
Subsubsection Text: We believe that providing a consistent high-quality service is critical in our customers’ decision to retain our services and for us to build long-term relationships with them. Our quality control framework is based on the certification of our operations and processes, regular process audits by our internal compliance team and independent external quality assurance providers. Our operations and processes are certified to the following internationally recognized standards: - UNI EN ISO 9001:2015: this standard regulates the provision of IT service solutions, the analysis, design and development of software, the design and supply of outsourcing services, the provision of computer systems installation, management and support and the design and provision of strategic ICT infrastructure, among others. - ISO 27001:2013: this standard regulates the design and provision for the retention of digital documents and the design, development and provision of services for the management of computerized administration of personnel, among others. - ISO 14001:2015: this standard regulates the provision of data center, hosting, housing, managed service, server farm, storage, backup and cloud services, among others. We are routinely subject to compliance audits by our customers in regards to the abovementioned standards.

Subsection Title: Environment and Sustainability
Subsubsection Text: We are committed to respecting the environment through the reduction of the impact of our business activities on the planet. We have implemented processes to this effect and systematically evaluate the environmental impact of our activities, including through our efforts to use a responsible supply chain. To this end, we have partnered with EcoVadis and we have launched a responsible purchasing program and work to detect and ----- minimize the risk of serious diolations of human rights, fundamental freedoms and to protect health, personal safety and the environment. Through our partnership with EcoVadis, we expect that our corporate and social responsibility assessment will be integrated into our selection process for our strategic suppliers and that the annual purchasing costs stemming from IT suppliers audited by EcoVadis as a percentage of total purchasing costs stemming from IT suppliers (excluding sub-contractors), will increase in France, Spain, Portugal and Belgium (with a target of 50% for the year ended December 31, 2022 and rising incrementally every year to a target of 80% for the year ended December 31, 2028). Although we consider our activities to have a low pollution risk, we have implemented an ISO 14001:2015-certified environmental management system, a certification which covers our Romanian subsidiary and Spanish subsidiaries in Madrid and Bilbao. This management system allows us to systematically evaluate the environmental impact of our activities, monitor performance and improve processes linked to the relevant environmental factors (electricity consumption, fuel and electronic waste and risks related to land spills). We also comply with applicable legislation with respect to the control of emissions into the atmosphere, soil and water. We deploy resources that we consider sufficient for the implementation of our environmental policies and objectives. In order to limit our carbon foot print and greenhouse gas emissions, we have adopted a policy that encourages employees to (i) use low-carbon transport and (ii) use digital communication systems to limit travel to the minimum necessary, thereby ensuring a decline in CO2 and other polluting emissions caused by our employees. The total grams of carbon dioxide per employee emitted by our company due to business travel and energy consumption decreased by approximately 51% between 2019 and 2021(driven by remote working, green energy and green mobility efforts), with a modest increase expected in 2022 and a further 20% decrease targeted over the next 6 years. As of June 30, 2022, electric vehicles and hybrid vehicles represented 10% and 50% of our fleet, respectively. Our ambition is to replace 20% of our car fleet with electric or hybrid or rechargeable hybrid vehicles with low CO2 emissions by the end of 2022. We also limit our offices’ energy consumption by extending on-site selective sorting, increasing waste recovery, managing waste electrical and electronic equipment and maximizing the life cycle of resources to prevent pollution. Since March 2021, the electricity purchased from EDF at the French sites has been 100% renewable.
